Author: jl777c#5810
Content: be careful giving out txid. combined with access to your wallet, some of the tx details are extractable

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you sent it, a lot of details could still be in your wallet via the opid, though doing a z_getoperationresult seems to make a lot of it go away, not sure if it is totally purged though.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: even as a recipient giving out the txid allows someone with access to the wallet to see the amount and the memo field

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: however, who sent it is not visible. what zaddr received is not there either, though it would likely be possible to correlate that with the wallet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is quite impressive how little data is available even with full access to the wallet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: after you do a z_getoperationresult, it seems there is no info about any of the opids

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so if you have a bunch of ztx and you want to reduce the data exposed, do a z_getoperationresult. but keep in mind that after you do that, even with a blockchain rescan, all you would be able to extract are the txid/amount/memo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @pbca26 would be a good GUI button to have to wipe the opid via z_getoperationresult, with the proper warnings

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: not doing the z_getoperationresult on a rather busy wallet also has been amongst my problems

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: it seems build up a wave of slowness in front of it if you dont
